title: feat: display byte length of CID
body: It's really useful to know the length of a CID and that it can vary depending on what it represents, e.g. the identity CID holding a private key. Example:

title: Add binary byte length of a CID
body:
It would be useful to know how long a CID is in bytes.

This would be especially useful for folks storing CIDs in space constraints environments like blockchains.


This was also partially inspired by Ryan's blog post https://blag.thedisco.zone/?post=cidfacts

```
Let's say I have a v0 CID:

QmXS8zmXsBVGvdPzj3QFVrzJUcKaaUkEVhHMFvgxUJdVFT
I can convert it to a v1 CID:

$ ipfs cid base32 QmXS8zmXsBVGvdPzj3QFVrzJUcKaaUkEVhHMFvgxUJdVFT
bafybeieheejcn4tspx5re74waw2ixp6hw6rvsssjlf6c3eivcy7oooqjay
But that got longer, so what if I wanted to include it in an NFT, using as little data as possible? Well then I'd use the [identity base with raw encoding](https://github.com/multiformats/multicodec/blob/master/table.csv):

$ ipfs cid format -b identity -c raw bafybeieheejcn4tspx5re74waw2ixp6hw6rvsssjlf6c3eivcy7oooqjay
p ?!&?r}?????«∑?YJIY|-?>?:
We went from our 46 byte v0 CID, to a 59 byte v1 CID, to a 37 byte raw CID. We can easily go back the same way we initially got the v1 CID as well:

$ ipfs cid format -b identity -c raw bafybeieheejcn4tspx5re74waw2ixp6hw6rvsssjlf6c3eivcy7oooqjay > rawcid
$ cat rawcid | ipfs cid base32
bafybeieheejcn4tspx5re74waw2ixp6hw6rvsssjlf6c3eivcy7oooqjay
```

title: chore: update dependencies
body: This PR updates the dependencies of this repository, including Parcel. Tachyons includes some not-global CSS features and therefore we need the option `errorRecovery` for the CSS processor. Before this PR, we used to patch Tachyons. More info in #45

title: Add content to inspector
body:
Adds complementary technical content to multiformats throughout the inspector. Think it is reasonable to say that the inspector can generally be updated with enhanced UI/UX

cc. @lidel

title: fix: support peer id
body:
Fixes #48.

I did the least "invasive" change until we implement tests #47

title: Support legacy (raw) PeerIDs in Base58btc
body:
Context: https://github.com/libp2p/specs/blob/master/RFC/0001-text-peerid-cid.md

In short, PeerIDs are not CIDs, but can be represented as one (CIDv1 with libp2p-key codec).

Due to this, easy UX win is to detect raw PeerID like  `12D3KooWJHxkQKX8C5KAyqEPhn2ssT2in4TExyG9SXxi519tycL9` 
and should show meaningful error that pasted identifier is not a CID, but can be represented as one, and show the CIDified version:

```console
$ ipfs id --peerid-base base36 12D3KooWJHxkQKX8C5KAyqEPhn2ssT2in4TExyG9SXxi519tycL9 --offline | jq  .ID
k51qzi5uqu5djbl2zsl8ooauuh7wb1ycesq93g72iym71shji1pbntl1vuyuk2
```

title: Add regression tests
body:
We should have a test for each:
- CIDv0 (`QmbWqxBEKC3P8tqsKc98xmWNzrzDtRLMiMPL8wBuTGsMnR`)
- CIDv1 base32
  - dag-pb
  - raw
  - dag-json
  - dag-cbor
- CIDv1 base36
  - libp2p-key codec
- PeerID (not a CID, but pasting `12D3KooWJHxkQKX8C5KAyqEPhn2ssT2in4TExyG9SXxi519tycL9` should show meaningful error as noted in https://github.com/multiformats/cid-utils-website/issues/48)

title: Remove CircleCI
body:
As noted in  #45  we  switched to GithubActions and want to disable CircleCI builds at:
https://app.circleci.com/jobs/github/multiformats/cid-utils-website/68


I don't have access to Mutliformats org.  
Perhaps  @rvagg @warpfork  can help?

title: feat: new multiformats
body:
- [x] Support for emoji CIDs (closes #44)
- [x] Support for [_any_](https://github.com/multiformats/multicodec/blob/master/table.csv) CIDs (closes #43)
- [x] Show base-encoded multihash (closes #40)
- [x] Update Parcel
	- When [this issue](https://github.com/parcel-bundler/parcel/issues/7854#issuecomment-1179483481) is solved, we can remove the Tachyons patch and use the `errorRecovery` option instead.
- [x] Change Circle CI to GitHub 
	- Circle CI removal tracked in https://github.com/multiformats/cid-utils-website/issues/46 (we don't have permissions)
- [x] support CIDv0
	
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5447088/180994829-e93de72b-0ba2-488d-a6c8-7ee6ba6c697b.png)

## After this PR

- Add service worker or some other kind of check to update the multicodec table such that we do not have to always deploy this
- Tests, tests, and more tests.

title: Can't decode emoji CIDs
body:
Similar problem as #43. IPFS now supports emoji CIDs adn cid.ipfs.io does not.

example from @ribasushi
https://cid.ipfs.io/#üöÄü™ê‚≠êüíªüòÖ‚ùìüíéüåàüå∏üåöüí∞üíçüåíüòµüê∂üíÅü§êüåéüëºüôÉüôÖ‚ò∫üåöüòûü§§‚≠êüöÄüòÉ‚úàüåïüòöüçªüíúüê∑‚öΩ‚úåüòä

The main blocker here is that to fix it the guts of the site will have to be rewritten to use the [new multiformats lib](https://github.com/multiformats/js-multiformats/)

title: Can't decode CAR CIDs
body:
There is a multicodec for CARs now. CIDs exist in the wild for them. This site can't decode them yet as it's got an old version of the multicodecs table.

The old ways must give way to the new. [`multicodecs`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/multicodec) is not updated. [`multiformats`](https://github.com/multiformats/js-multiformats) is where the action is.

As suggested by @ribasushi It might be worth reworking this site so that we don't have to redeploy it every time the table is updated. Historical note, it was built this way so that it was self contained, and the site would work entire offline if you have the dag for the site root.

title: Show valid parameters of invalid CIDs instead of just an error
body: If you modify https://cid.ipfs.io/#bafk2bzaceaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa to be one character shorter than it should be, all the information disappears save for the `multihash length inconsistent:` error even though the valid multibase, multicodec, etc, are still present. It'd be nice if only certain sections were omitted when invalid parameters were present.

title: Adjustable CID parameters
body:
https://cid.ipfs.io/#bafk2bzaceaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa tells the user about the CID, however, it'd be nice if some of the parameters were dropdowns so you could see what the CID looks like if slightly changed.

e.g. Changing `Name: base32` to `Name: base36` with a dropdown menu that shows all multibases available. This is especially useful since some encodings mean the characters don't neatly align to a single, whole byte each.

It might also be of benefit to give the user the option to manually type in multiformat codes to see how non-standard multiformats would be encoded.

title: show multihash for a cid
body:
the `ipfs block` commands work with multihashes rather than CIDs. It would he helpful to be able to paste in a CID and see it's base encoded multihash that could be pasted into one of those commands.

in the meantime you can
```console
$ ipfs --offline cid format -f %m zb2rhe5P4gXftAwvA4eXQ5HJwsER2owDyS9sKaQRRVQPn93bA                                                                                                 
zQmVmkadKS2uvxyD6YJJzd3Umem6SWV7QxYnL7kbpdWAsPS
```

title: "human-readable" CID form should match spec
body:
...or spec should match what this site does.

https://github.com/multiformats/cid#human-readable-cids
```
# corresponding human readable CID
base58btc - cidv1 - raw - sha2-256-256-6e6ff7950a36187a801613426e858dce686cd7d7e3c0fc42ee0330072d245c95
```

https://cid.ipfs.io/#zb2rhe5P4gXftAwvA4eXQ5HJwsER2owDyS9sKaQRRVQPn93bA
```
Human readable CID
base58btc - cidv1 - raw - (sha2-256 : 256 : 6E6FF7950A36187A801613426E858DCE686CD7D7E3C0FC42EE0330072D245C95)
```

title: Add ability to convert v1 to v0
body:
I often need v0 for cloudflare compatibility.

There is already v0 to v1 convertor

title: When identity mulihash uses a raw codec and contains ascii only characters, show decoded form
body:
Would be super useful as cid utils website is my primary way of decoding Filecoin code CIDs.
Example https://cid.ipfs.io/#bafkqadtgnfwc6mjpnv2wy5djonuwo

title: fix: multicodec hex conversion
body: Fixes #21

title: fix: broken images, multihash break down
body:
This PR intended to fix broken IPLD image, but ended up with a bunch of improvements:

- updated dependencies
- images are now self-hosted, so won't break in the future
- added "Docs" link
- improved contrast by replacing `grey` with `charcoal-muted`
- unified font used in "legend" 
- output sections are hidden when no CID is entered
- capitalized multihash digest to highlight it is the raw value in HEX
- multihash break down is now annotated and (hopefully) less confusing
  - before:
    > ![Screenshot_2020-10-15 CID Inspector IPFS(1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/157609/96178373-986b9900-0f2f-11eb-81f3-8e668d6346e8.png)
  - after:
    > ![Screenshot_2020-10-15 CID Inspector IPFS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/157609/96178331-8984e680-0f2f-11eb-9932-c859ea45e815.png)


## Preview 

- https://bafybeiabjejvx3jieijxqj24xlrxcjsi7glhe2chv6efsh4k62qqabj3k4.on.fleek.co?x-ipfs-companion-no-redirect

title: Fix ipld logo
body: Looks like all requests to https://ipld.io now redirect to https://docs.ipld.io, so the logo in the footer doesn't load, I've just added the logo directly to this repo instead.

title: chore: move hosting to Fleek
body:
I tried to apply fix from https://github.com/ipfs-shipyard/ipfs-webui/pull/1620 but it still [failed](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/multiformats/cid-utils-website/25/workflows/7740035f-d155-493a-a7d3-76d923e6dd74/jobs/51). 
https://cid.ipfs.io is a small website, so I suggest we move its hosting to Fleek. 

- [x] I've already set up Fleek integration under `cid-utils-website` name and it builds `master` + there is a preview on PRs
- [x] :point_right:  **We need to update  `cid.ipfs.io` in DNS to point at Fleek** 
  > ![details here](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/157609/93610645-9dd7d100-f9cd-11ea-99a9-d98ce947710a.png)


@mburns are you able to help with updating DNS? 
(would not bother you, but we want to land this before people start playing with go-ipfs 0.7)

title: feat: provide cidv1 in base36 when needed
body:
This adds Base36 version  of CIDv1 if it fits inside a single DNS label. 
Follows convention introduced in https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/pull/7441 where we redirect to Base36 version if it helps with DNS limit.

> ![2020-08-26--22-12-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/157609/91351896-50f74500-e7e9-11ea-9fe5-ebca159b05c3.png)


Examples:
- [regular CID, Base32 is enough, Base36 section is hidden](https://bafybeigmo2fidbzsy27pbcwmt2net6p2bli4m54gipmdnjkvtjyd5gue2i.ipfs.dweb.link/#bafybeigdyrzt5sfp7udm7hu76uh7y26nf3efuylqabf3oclgtqy55fbzdi)
- [libp2p-key, Base36 is provided](https://bafybeigmo2fidbzsy27pbcwmt2net6p2bli4m54gipmdnjkvtjyd5gue2i.ipfs.dweb.link/#bafzaajaiaejcat4yhiwnr2qz73mtu6vrnj2krxlpfoa3wo2pllfi37quorgwh2jw)
- [super long CID, DNS label warning is displayed instead of Base36](https://bafybeigmo2fidbzsy27pbcwmt2net6p2bli4m54gipmdnjkvtjyd5gue2i.ipfs.dweb.link/#bafkrgqhhyivzstcz3hhswshfjgy6ertgmnqeleynhwt4dlfsthi4hn7zgh4uvlsb5xncykzapi3ocd4lzogukir6ksdy6wzrnz6ohnv4aglcs)


Q: Is it ok to hide Base36 when it is not really needed? Or maybe should we always show it, to educate users that the same CID  can be encoded  in different bases? In that case we could have CIDV1 header and then multiple base versions listed under that.

cc @ribasushi @aschmahmann @jessicaschilling

body: Link to this repo from the tool itself so that people can open issues if things don't work as expected or if they have ideas for improvements.

body:
Bumps [serialize-to-js](https://github.com/commenthol/serialize-to-js) from 3.0.0 to 3.0.1.
Commits - [`89c82a8`](https://github.com/commenthol/serialize-to-js/commit/89c82a8d993c122834597f620c50c11a3798500d) 3.0.1 - [`d0234d3`](https://github.com/commenthol/serialize-to-js/commit/d0234d3a3cea6edaeb2c22df0d359164967234a2) Merge pull request [#14](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/commenthol/serialize-to-js/issues/14) from commenthol/fix-regex-xss - [`181d7d5`](https://github.com/commenthol/serialize-to-js/commit/181d7d583ae5293cd47cc99b14ad13352875f3e3) fix: for ghsa-3fjq-93xj-3f3f - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/commenthol/serialize-to-js/compare/v3.0.0...v3.0.1)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=serialize-to-js&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=3.0.0&new-version=3.0.1)](https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot ignore this [patch|minor|major] version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor/major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/multiformats/cid-utils-website/network/alerts).

title: Fix link under header logo
body: Changed header logo link to go to ipfs.io - was multiformats.io

title: fix: add support for libp2p-key multicodec
body:
## Motivation

 `libp2p-key`  was added in https://github.com/multiformats/multicodec/issues/130 but https://cid.ipfs.io/ does not support it yet:

> ![2019-08-16--13-33-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/157609/63253659-8ed69a80-c272-11e9-9331-a9c7f45fb76d.png)

## Change 

This PR adds support for `libp2p-key` multicodec to  unblock https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/issues/5287 and https://github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p-core/pull/41
It also bumps other dependencies to the latest versions.

title: feat: bring back IPFS preview on PR
body:
- move ci to circle and add ipfs-dns-deploy
- flip to using npm instead of yarn, as per our other sites

License: MIT
Signed-off-by: Oli Evans <oli@tableflip.io>

title: Proposal: Moving CID to multiformats Org
body: Please review https://github.com/ipld/cid/issues/26

title: ‚Äú404 page not found‚Äù
body: The http://cid-utils.ipfs.team/ website returns 404 Not Found.

title: chore: move src to src dir
body:
Fixes inotify errors found in #7. The build process now only has to
watch the src dir rather than the whole project.

Brings external img refs inline so all the things are deployed to ipfs.

License: MIT
Signed-off-by: Oli Evans <oli@tableflip.io>

title: Update cids dep.
body:
base32 encoded cids created with 0.5.2 can't be unpacked by cids 0.5.3

This PR upgrades our cids dep to 0.5.3 so we don't start suggesting base32
cids that can't be used.

License: MIT
Signed-off-by: Oli Evans <oli@tableflip.io>

title: always show base32cidv1 version
body:
This will display a base32 cidv1 with each inspection of a hash.

Context: https://github.com/ipfs/go-ipfs/issues/4143 and https://github.com/ipfs/developer-meetings/pull/16

![b32](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28153/42300907-8037a602-7fc7-11e8-8511-e48ec8b4ddc9.png)

Requesting a new release of the site if possible after merging, thanks!

title: README description of fix for max inotify issues
body: Better fix is to move source code to subdir so inotify isn't listening to a bunch of node_modules, but whatever.

title: Show cid error messages to user
body: The error messages are good, so show them to the user to help them correct their unhealthy CID. Also fix the layout on mobile. Parcel has some super aggressive minification, which removevs the input elements type!? Anyway, that meant border-box sizing wasn't being applied when deployed, so we'd end up with a horizontal scrollbar on mobile. This tool isn't gonna be used on phones so much, but that was like the second bit of feedback i got on it so thanks @richsilv. üòâ Fixes #5

title: Add error reporting
body:
If anything goes wrong while we're unpacking the CID, because of a malformed CID or we have a bug, then the error is currently just logged to the console.

Malformed CID errors should be show to the user, a form that helps them figure out what's wrong with their CID where possible.

title: Add tool for converting cidv0s to cidv1s and back
Add tool to convert human-readable to encoded CID format
body: Add a CID builder that lets you create a CID from drop downs for each multiformat, or let's you paste in a human CID to get the encoded version out.

title: Add human readable format and style up
body: Display CID in "human-readable" format by default, as per [here](https://github.com/ipld/cid#human-readable-cids) Adds a deploy script to push to ipfs and track versions and some ipfs styling Preview: https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmPqtLpiwvNztmLmH6vXoi3DhLtr2dbnAFTSkFvw8P5JQh/#zb2rhe5P4gXftAwvA4eXQ5HJwsER2owDyS9sKaQRRVQPn93bA
